Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

When hardware acceleration is enabled and the page is zoomed in one step or more a keyboard input lag is introduced in textfields on many pages, facebook being a good example. Being in normal magnification doesn't cause this issue.

I have the latest nvidia drivers on a multi gpu system with 3 monitors.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1: Leave the option "Hardware acceleration when possible" on.
2: Goto facebook.com and go to your newsfeed.
3: zoom in one level or more (ctrl-+)
4: Start entering text in the "What's on your mind" textbox and there will be a keybaord input lag. If you type relatively fast you will type faster than text appears on screen making noticing errors annoying.

Notes:
- zooming out to normal level (ctrl-0) fixes the problem.
- the problem arise in similar ways on other pages too, in different severity but always present.
Actual Results:  
Keyboard input lags

Expected Results:  
No keyboard lag?

Turning off acceleration when possible fixes the problem, but breaks everything needing this feature of course.
comments.creator: kristian@tigersoul.se
